CatDescriptText: Harry T. Spring, creative designer, Shadyside and William Scheble, retired, 27 Ward, were part of the Pittsburghers Speak Up column published in Pittsburgh Courier Newspaper, November 12, 1960, pg. A1 with question: "If you were President of the United States, would you appoint a Negro to the cabinet?  Do you think there is a Negro or Negroes qualified for a cabinet post?"  Mr. Spring's answer reads: "I would judge on qualification and not color.  I'm not in a position to identify the qualifications.  There may be some who have the stature but I don't know that much about them."  Mr. Scheble's answer reads: "I think I would because they have as much right as anybody else.  We're all Americans...I imagine there are a good many Negroes qualified for cabinet posts..."
TitMainTitle: Two Frames: Portrait of Harry T. Spring wearing dark dot patterned necktie and dark trenchcoat with light colored lining, standing on sidewalk in front of building; Portrait of William Scheble wearing fedora and eyeglasses, standing on sidewalk in front of light colored building
